ngoList.title: Sampurna
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sampurna is a Social Welfare Organization working towards the total development of the society. It is functioning since Sept. 1993 and has gone much ahead in rendering services like counselling, development cum training services, awareness campaigns, self employment projects along with other voluntary/Government agencies etc. to the under-privileged, unaware and depressed sections of the society. We have extended our services and the scope of development to cover the vast sections of people including middle class so that full justice is done to our basic aim and objectives. To maximize the potential of an individual, various alternatives are provided at Sampurna. we are running various activities for the use of the nearby down trodden and weaker sections of society as mentioned below at a glance: Pre-School Education (2-6 years), Adult Education for females (15 years & above), Integrated Cutting Tailoring and Designing, Bangles Fabrication-Self Employment project, Vocational Training Programmes (affiliated to national open school), Beauty Training Courses (ITC), Family Counselling Centre, Dental Assistance Course, Student self-help programme, Night Shelter, Health Awareness Camps, Community Counselling, Health/Cultural Melas, Mass Marriages, Bal Sanskar Shivirs, Mental Health Workshop, Career Counselling Workshops, English Speaking Course, Recreation Centre for Sr. Citizens, Mobile Van Dispensary, Sampurna GRC/SSK.

ngoList.title: SANGEET NIKETAN
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sangeet Niketan was established with the aim of education and propagation of Classical Music and Kathak Dance on 01-01-1950 by Shri Gulab Rai, Sangeet Vachaspati at 2666, Ballimaran, Delhi - 110006. The second branch of Sangeet Niketan was started during the year 1990 at G-365 Preet Vihar, Delhi - 110092 the third branch of Sangeet Niketan was started during the year 1997 at Malviya Nagar, New Delhi - 110017. The head office was subsequently transferred at G - 365, Preet Vihar, Delhi - 110092 in the year 2012. Sangeet Niketan, Delhi was Affiliated with Indira Kala Sangeet Vishwavidyalaya, Khairagarh (Chhattisgarh) During the year 1958. Since then, University Examinations are being conducted at Sangeet Niketan, Delhi every year. During the year 2015-16, 227 students were imparted education in Sangeet Niketan in various fields of Music i.e. Vocal Instrumental and Kathak Dance, out of which there were 31 boys and 196 girls. In the year 2015-16, University Examinations were held in February, 2016, in which 169 students appeared in the University Examinations of various classes. It is informed that out of 169 students, who appeared in the Examinations, 161 students have passed with flying colours. It is a matter of great pleasure that out of 161 passed students, most of them have secured First Division. Sangeet Niketan celebrated its 65th Annual Function on the 31st January, 2016 at LTG Auditorium, New Delhi. More than four hundred members of audience attended and appreciated the performances. In the Function more than 150 students participated and took active part in the field of Vocal, Instrumental and Kathak Dance programmes. The function was very much appreciated by the Chief Guest Dr. Sonal Mansingh, Padma Vibhushan and the audience as well as by the press.

ngoList.title: Sanjivini Society for Mental Health
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sanjivini is Delhiâ€™s premier non-profit organization that has, since 1976, tirelessly addressed the emotional and mental health needs of society through counselling and rehabilitation of persons afflicted with schizophrenia. Our work is primarily carried out at two main units - the Counselling or Crisis Intervention Unit and the Rehabilitation Centre. At these centres, primary interventions as well as community-based and preventive initiatives are carried out. Below is a brief write up about our various programmes: Crisis Intervention: This Unit provides free and confidential psycho-social counselling for a wide spectrum of emotional distress and mental health problems, ranging from self esteem issues, inter-personal problems, depression, suicide, substance abuse and severe mental disorders. Our trained volunteer counsellors carry out this counselling. Rehabilitation Centre: This pioneering programme, which works towards the rehabilitation of persons suffering from chronic schizophrenia, has become a module that is being replicated by many other institutions. It is a full day therapeutic facility, which uses therapy at the group, individual and family levels. Referral Service: Through extensive networking with other organizations, we have built up a huge referral service. Equipped with this, we help our clients to get legal, medical or other specialized help, as required by them. Community Outreach Programme: Over the years, the sustained efforts of our ongoing Community Outreach initiatives have been directed towards the goal of destigmatizing counselling by raising the awareness of the community about different aspects of emotional and mental health and the help available. Basic Counselling Skills Course: This annually conducted workshop equips helpers in the community such as teachers, doctors and counselors with skills not only to make them better helper but also helps them to build more awareness of self which further leads to better relationship. In recognition of our contribution to society, Sanjivini has been honoured with the Sanskriti Award for 1982 and the Delhi Government award for valuable services rendered in 1998.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Schumacher Centreâ€™s mission is to â€œtouch lives in rural Indiaâ€ by enhancing the livelihoods of the poor, deprived and marginalized. The Centre (SC) functions as a bridge to link Indiaâ€™s rural poor with government, business and the civil sector, in an effort to improve their lives. Our work focuses on the entire value chain when addressing livelihood such that the continuum of Production â†’ Technology â†’ Market is taken into account. Markets must work for the poor and inversely, the rural poor must come to the market in a socially and environmentally coherent manner. As such, a tri sector approach is needed: the government sector for legal support, civil society as facilitators and social mobilisers, and the private sector for technology, finance and market. If any of the links in the chain is missing, the livelihood prospect is diminished. Most development organizations look at either of the three, not the whole chain because it calls for a developmental approach which ought to lead to self-empowerment and entrepreneurship. There are attempts being made but few replicable models presently exist. SC has spent the last few years working on livelihood from multiple angles in order to best understand how to intercede efficiently. This holistic approach allows us to on those projects where we can bring value addition to those in the villages. The Centres achievement is the collaborative developmental activities that it completed with various national and International organisations and experts.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Score works towards empowering and integrating blind and visually impaired citizens into the mainstream. Our main activities include communications advocacy and counseling through which we inform and inspire blind people to become self reliant. We operate a national toll free helpline which is manned by visually impaired counselors in different states across India. Our counselors inform callers about the possibilities of living life with blindness.
